title: Vegas rides late birdie binge to 64, leads PGA
content: Jhonattan Vegas made five birdies on his last six holes to shoot 7-under 64 -- his best score in 45 rounds at the majors -- and leads the PGA Championship by two shots.

title: QB Williams sought to avoid Bears, book details
content: Quarterback Caleb Williams looked to find a way around the NFL's collective bargaining agreement in an effort to avoid being drafted by the Chicago Bears, details from a forthcoming book reveal.

title: Source: 49ers selling 6.2% of team to 3 families
content: The San Francisco 49ers are working to complete the sale of a 6.2% ownership stake in the team to three Bay Area families, a source told ESPN on Thursday.

title: Steph 'excited' about returning with Butler, Green
content: Stephen Curry says he is excited about returning in the fall and playing a full season with Draymond Green and Jimmy Butler.

title: 'Gentleman' Flick pulls Barça off field before party
content: Barcelona coach Hansi Flick was praised for getting his celebrating players off the pitch as tensions threatened to spill over after they secured the LaLiga title on Thursday with a 2-0 win at Espanyol.

title: Suns again sued by employee for discrimination
content: A current employee has sued the Suns, citing allegations of discrimination, harassment and retaliation, according to a copy of the complaint obtained by ESPN.

title: 100 days until CFB: Storylines and more
content: With just 100 days until Week 0, we take a look at 100 things to know ahead of the college football season.

title: WNBA season preview: Power Rankings, playoff odds and everything to know about all 13 teams
content: Where do all 13 teams start in ESPN's WNBA Power Rankings? Will they make the playoffs? Can the Liberty win another title?

title: 'I think he's on a mission': How Mikko Rantanen has leveled up in the 2025 playoffs
content: Following two trades during the regular season, the Finnish superstar has finally found his groove in Dallas.

title: MLB Power Rankings: Who's No. 1 in mid-May?
content: The Tigers roar into the top three this week, while the Subway Series in the Bronx will be a clash of two top-five teams.

title: The 49ers are back! Trouble for the Cowboys! Let's overreact to the NFL schedule reveal
content: Will the 49ers roll into the playoffs? Can the Giants, Lions and Cowboys overcome tough slates? Let's size up schedule reveal fallout.

title: Each NFL teams' social media 2025 schedule release
content: The 2025 NFL schedule was released Wednesday, prompting unique reveals by multiple teams on social media.

title: 'We don't want to be a one-hit wonder': Expectations on the rise for Indiana, Cignetti
content: After an impressive first year under coach Curt Cignetti, what do the Hoosiers have in store for Year 2?

title: How every rookie QB fits with his new NFL team: Who will play in 2025 -- and who has long-term potential?
content: Which quarterbacks landed in perfect spots? We look at expectations, fits and roles for all 13 drafted QBs, including two first-rounders.

title: Man City keep or dump: How should Guardiola & Co. rebuild?
content: It's been a bad season for Pep Guardiola and Man City, and it's clear they're in a full rebuild mode. Who has a future on this team?

title: Müller says goodbye as Bundesliga's dramatic final day looms
content: Thomas Müller already said farewell to the Bayern Munich faithful. Now he'll wave goodbye to Bundesliga.

title: Fans injured as car hits crowd before Barça derby
content: Over a dozen people were injured when a car drove into a crowd of Espanyol supporters before the club's LaLiga match against Barcelona on Thursday.

title: Sources: Madrid set to sign Huijsen before CWC
content: Real Madrid have reached an agreement in principle to sign Dean Huijsen from Bournemouth for £50 million before the Club World Cup, sources told ESPN.

title: Furious Messi saved from red card by Arena
content: San Jose Earthquakes head coach Bruce Arena helped save Lionel Messi from receiving a red card following the final whistle of Wednesday night's game against Inter Miami.

title: UEFA slams Infantino's late arrival from Trump tour
content: FIFA president Gianni Infantino's late arrival from the Middle East, where he joined President Donald Trump, delayed the opening of FIFA's annual meeting.

title: Messi, Garnacho return for Argentina qualifiers
content: Argentina will have captain Lionel Messi back for its FIFA World Cup qualifiers against Chile and Colombia, the national team announced Thursday.

title: Bompastor: Ohanian investment 'game-changing'
content: Sonia Bompastor praised Reddit co-founder and Serena Williams' husband Alexis Ohanian's investment into the club, calling it "game-changing."

title: Madrid's Asencio may be charged for explicit video
content: Real Madrid defender Raúl Asencio and three former teammates from the club's youth teams could face criminal charges for allegedly recording sexual images of a woman and a minor and distributing them without their consent.

title: Amorim: UEL final places on line vs. Chelsea
content: Ruben Amorim has told Manchester United's stars that they risk being left on the bench for the Europa League final if they don't perform against Chelsea.

title: A-Rod among well-wishers on Jayson Tatum's postsurgery Instagram post
content: The star forward recently completed surgery on his right Achilles tendon that was ruptured on Monday.

title: Jayson Tatum's injury timeline and what to learn from other NBA stars' Achilles tears
content: Following Tatum's devastating Achilles injury Monday, what has recovery looked like for other NBA stars?

title: New NBA mock draft: We project all 59 picks
content: With the Mavericks winning the lottery and the right to draft Cooper Flagg, here's our updated two-round mock.

title: Amid growing pains at Ferrari, will Hamilton win in F1 again?
content: Lewis Hamilton is not accustomed to losing, but he's been doing a lot of it. Will that ever change at Ferrari?

title: UFC Fight Night: Does Burns have a best path to ending Morales' unbeaten run?
content: Who has the edge in this week's UFC Fight Night? An MMA coach and a betting insider make their picks.

title: What Marshall, Holm and others signing with MVP means for women's boxing
content: Andreas Hale takes a closer look at the new fighters in the MVP roster and shares his thoughts on the matchups already made.

title: 2025 NFL schedule analysis: Projections, odds, players to upgrade and downgrade
content: The friendliest and toughest slates in fantasy, who makes the NFL playoffs and the race for the No. 1 pick in 2026.

title: Legit or impostor? Predicting whether the NWSL teams defying expectations can keep it up
content: The early-season form of many NWSL teams has been surprising. Let's dig deeper and predict whether this will continue or if it's a blip.

title: Transfer rumors, news: Barcelona, Liverpool, Madrid interested in Adam Wharton
content: Barcelona, Liverpool and Real Madrid are keeping close tabs on England international Adam Wharton. Transfer Talk has the latest news, gossip and rumors.

title: Pakistan PM Shehbaz Sharif Offers Dialogue With India "For Peace"
content: Prime Minister Shehbaz Sharif on Thursday extended an offer of talks to India, saying Pakistan is ready to engage "for peace".

title: Ex-FBI Director Under Scanner For Alleged Assassination Threat To Trump
content: US law enforcement agencies are investigating an alleged assassination threat against President Donald Trump by former FBI director James Comey, Homeland Security Secretary Kristi Noem said Thursday.

title: Depressed After Wife's Death, Odisha Man, 2 Children Die By Suicide: Cops
content: A 40-year-old man and his two children allegedly killed themselves by consuming poisoned biryani in Odisha's Gajapati district, police said on Thursday.

title: 80 People Killed In Gaza As Israel Intensifies Bombardment
content: At least 80 Palestinians were killed and dozens of others wounded in Israeli airstrikes across Gaza, said Palestinian medical sources.

title: Video: Men Perform Stunts, Hold Hands Across Cars In Mumbai, Arrested
content: A First Information Report (FIR) was registered against three men after they were seen driving recklessly and performing stunts in the vehicle in Chembur area of Mumbai earlier this week.

title: 1200 Schools Shut Down In Himachal In Over 2 Years Due To Low Enrolments
content: A total of 1,200 schools have been closed in Himachal Pradesh in the past two and a half years, Education Minister Rohit Thakur said on Thursday.

title: India Remains Fastest-Growing Economy At "Precarious Moment" For World: UN
content: India remains the fastest-growing large economy and is expected to record a 6.3 per cent growth this fiscal year, while the global economy faces a "precarious moment," according to the UN.

title: Gaza's Last Cancer Hospital Stops Working After Israeli Attack: WHO
content: The World Health Organization said Thursday that the last hospital in Gaza providing cancer and cardiac care had stopped functioning after an Israeli attack.

title: Samajwadi MP's 'Caste' Remark On Wing Commander Vyomika Singh Sparks Row
content: Uttar Pradesh Minister Baby Rani Maurya on Thursday criticised Samajwadi Party MP Ram Gopal Yadav over his remarks on Wing Commander Vyomika Singh, saying that making caste-related comments is condemnable.

title: Trump Announces $200 Billion In Deals With UAE, AI Agreement Also Signed
content: President Donald Trump on Thursday pledged to strengthen U.S. ties to the United Arab Emirates and announced deals with the Gulf state totalling over $200 billion and the two countries also agreed to deepen cooperation in artificial intelligence.

title: Ahead Of Peace Talks, Zelensky Says Russia "Does Not Want To End War"
content: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy on Thursday announced that a Ukrainian delegation will participate in talks with Russia in Istanbul, with the primary goal of achieving a ceasefire.

title: In A First, S Jaishankar Speaks To Taliban Foreign Minister, Scripts History
content: Scripting a new chapter in regional dynamics, External Affairs Minister S Jaishankar on Thursday spoke with the Taliban's acting Foreign Minister Amir Khan Muttaqi over an official phone call.

title: CRPF Officer Killed, Another Injured In Jharkhand Lightning Strike
content: A CRPF officer was killed while another was seriously injured after they were struck by lightning during an operation in Jharkhand on Thursday, officials said.

title: "Pak Massively Misusing Religion Breeding Jihadism": Military Historian Tom Cooper
content: Stating Pakistan is "massively misusing religion," breeding jihadism, Military aviation analyst and historian Tom Cooper said he does not expect the situation to change.

title: "Made A Sub-Human Of Me": Indian Scholar Recounts Torture In US Detention
content: Suri described his experience in detention as "Kafka-esque," saying he was chained everywhere - wrist, ankles, and body. "I was chained - my ankles, my wrist, my body. Everything was chained."

title: Nirav Modi's Petition For Bail Rejected Again By London Court: CBI
content: A fresh bail petition filed by fugitive diamond merchant Nirav Modi has been rejected by the High Court of Justice, King's Bench Division, London, the Central Bureau of Investigation has said. Nirav Modi has been in a jail in UK since March 2019.

title: 'Will Follow Court Orders': Mohan Yadav On Minister's Army Officer Remarks
content: After a prolonged silence, Madhya Pradesh Chief Minister Mohan Yadav has eventually addressed the controversy that has ignited the state's political landscape.

title: "Can't Stop Us": Row Over Rahul Gandhi's Visit To Bihar Hostel, Case Filed
content: Congress's Rahul Gandhi landed in controversy today after he went to meet students in Bihar at a hostel in Darbhanga, disregarding police barriers.

title: Can Donald Trump End US Birthright Citizenship? Explained
content: The US Supreme Court will hear arguments on Thursday on President Donald Trump's bid to broadly enforce his executive order ending birthright citizenship, a principle that has been recognized in the United States for more than 150 years.

title: Harvard Mobilizes Funds For "Critical Research" After Federal Cuts In Grants
content: Harvard University says it will plough $250 million into funding "critical research" after the US government announced fresh budget cuts to the elite school.

title: The big cost of watching a film on the large screen in Bengaluru
content: Bengaluru has remained infamous for high-priced movie tickets. The State government’s proposal to cap the ticket price at ₹200 came as a ray of hope for film buffs, but a similar move in 2017 had borne no result, writes Vivek M.V.

title: High level security review meeting held at Tirumala
content: Officials also discussed the formulation of Standard Operating Procedures (SOPs) for all security units including APSP, DAR, SPF, Home Guards, Civil Police, and TTD’s own security personnel

title: Slump in demand hits tobacco farmers in Andhra Pradesh
content: Higher production also leads to slash in prices in the global markets; the selling price is currently ₹262 per KG against ₹231 per KG during the corresponding season the previous year, says official

title: Complete land allotments in all MSME parks in 30 days, Minister tells APIIC
content: APIIC VC & MD Abhishikt Kishore and other senior officials participated in the meeting held at the APIIC headquarters in Mangalagiri

title: Task DWCRA groups with converting wet garbage into compost, Andhra Pradesh Chief Minister Naidu tells officials
content: Calling for an action plan on effective waste management, he insists on collection of garbage from houses daily, he directs that 52 clusters be set up across the State for grading of waste

title: No country for pacifists | What Operation Sindoor reveals
content: Operation Sindoor has laid bare the current shift in public opinion on what is the right response to conflict — blood lust and confrontational rhetoric drowning out common sense and calls for peace

title: Maharashtra CM Fadnavis applauds Pune traders for boycotting Turkiye produce
content: Traders at the Agricultural Produce Market Committee (APMC) in Pune have decided to stop imports from Turkiye; many people have also cancelled trips

title: Delhi HC refuses to accept TMC MP Saket Gokhale’s apology in a ‘sealed cover’
content: The court noted that Mr. Gokhale has not complied with the July 1, 2024 direction of the court to issue an apology and pay ₹50 lakh in damages to the former Indian diplomat

title: MHA directs officials to keep a tab on peddling of drugs online
content: In an apex meeting conducted with the Chief Secretaries, DGPs, heads of NCBs and DRIs, Union Home Secretary Govind Mohan stresses need for coordination among various departments

title: Maharashtra ATS claims Kerala journalist is ‘linked to terror outfits’; booked under UAPA
content: Court raps Maharashtra Police for failure to provide seizure documents, grants three days’ police custody; police say the accused has admitted to being in touch with Maoist leader and CPI (Maoist) central committee member Murali Kannempilly

title: Govt appoints Tushar Mehta-headed team of lawyers for trial against Tahawwur Rana
content: Rana has been charged with numerous offences, including conspiracy, murder, commission of a terrorist act and forgery in the country

title: Antioxidant-rich diet lowered risk of acute respiratory infection associated with air pollution in children: Study
content: The study, on Indian children under five, found that higher intake of certain antioxidant nutrients such as vitamins A, C and D, as well as minerals like zinc and selenium lowered the risk of ARI associated with high PM 2.5 exposure

title: Trade Unions defer general strike against Labour Codes to July 9
content: The decision was taken considering the prevailing situation after the Pahalgam attack, the joint platform of the Central Trade Unions said

title: India-Pakistan conflict: Government to form multi-party delegations for diplomatic outreach
content: The multiple delegations composed of prominent leaders and Parliamentarians from across the political lines will visit several key capital cities to interact with both government and the civil society groups, to present India’s viewpoint on the recent conflict and refocus attention on the core issue of terrorism

title: Amid tension, MEA postpones credentials ceremony featuring Turkish ambassador
content: The MEA, in a brief announcement, said “the credentials ceremony at Rashtrapati Bhavan has been deferred due to scheduling issues”

title: Nipah virus in Kerala | The return of the dread
content: Nipah’s deadly shadow returns to Malappuram, sparking a frantic race against time to contain the virus. Abdul Latheef Naha speaks to residents in the affected area and health experts to shed light on the virus and the district’s battle plan to keep it under control.

title: India’s talks with Pakistan will be ‘strictly bilateral’, says Jaishankar
content: “Absolutely” no change in “national consensus” on “strictly bilateral” format of talks with Pakistan, says External Affairs Minister as Trump says “helped” in ceasefire

title: SIB records net profit of ₹1,303 crore, recommends dividend of 40%
content: The bank’s operating profit of the year increased by 21.55% from ₹1,867.67 crore in FY 24 to ₹2,270.08 crore in FY 25

title: India and Pakistan will continue steps to reduce alertness level, says Army
content: Pakistan claims ‘military-to-military communications’ took place; Army chief General Dwivedi visits forward locations, lauds troops for their precise and bold actions during Operation Sindoor

title: Tamil Nadu Governor verdict: Experts debate whether Presidential Reference is a ploy to bypass judicial review
content: Senior advocate Kapil Sibal says by seeking a Reference, the govt is trying to ‘bypass the legal process’ available to it; Justice Sanjay Kishan Kaul, former SC judge, says the President had raised points of law and he was expecting ‘something like this to happen’

title: Gig workers seek minimum wages, social security
content: ‘The dictatorial and insensitive attitude of the companies is a regular feature in their life. There are no avenues of redress,’ a statement issued after a meeting on digital platform-based work said

title: M.P. High Court directs Defence Ministry to restore possession of 130-year-old property in Mhow
content: Court condemns “wholly illegal” eviction of sisters from disputed property; orders restoration within 15 days

title: In a first, External Affairs Minister Jaishankar talks to Taliban’s acting Foreign Minister Muttaqi
content: The conversation comes days after the Taliban administration, that India is yet to officially recognise, condemned the deadly terror strike in Pahalgam that left 26 innocents dead and dozens injured

title: UN launches an enquiry into Rohingya refugees being cast into the sea by Indian naval vessels
content: UN urges the Indian government to refrain from inhumane and life-threatening treatment of Rohingya refugees

title: Mumbai court issues bailable warrant to BJP MLA Nitesh Rane
content: Shiv Sena (UBT) leader Sanjay Raut had filed a complaint against Raut in 2023 for the latter’s defamatory and ‘blatantly false remarks’

title: US military strategist slams Trump admin for not blocking IMF aid to Pak
content: Michael Rubin, a US military strategist, criticized the Trump administration for allowing a $1 billion IMF bailout to Pakistan, which he views as a state sponsor of terrorism and a Chinese satellite. Rubin asserted that India won the conflict with Pakistan, dismissing Islamabad's claims and highlighting its defeat. He condemned the IMF's decision, especially after terrorist attacks in India.

title: Won’t permit any challenge to 1995 Waqf Act: SC bench
content: The Supreme Court will hear arguments on May 20 regarding the Waqf (Amendment) Act, 2025. The court limited the hearing to address the necessity of interim orders. The government submitted an affidavit addressing concerns raised by the court. The court refused challenges to the Waqf Act, 1995. Kapil Sibal will coordinate submissions on the need for interim relief.

title: Virat Kohli spotted with 'Jaap' machine after Test retirement
content: Following his Test cricket retirement announcement, Virat Kohli, accompanied by his wife Anushka Sharma, sought spiritual guidance from Premanand Maharaj in Vrindavan. Photos of their visit went viral, and Kohli was later seen with a Jaap counting machine. Photos of Kohli and Anushka interacting with Premanand Maharaj in Vrindavan quickly went viral on social media.

title: ‘Ceasefire’ extended till Sunday, claims Pak; no word from India yet
content: India and Pakistan have decided to continue confidence-building measures to de-escalate military tensions along the Line of Control and the international boundary. This decision follows an understanding reached on May 10 to cease cross-border hostilities, with both sides aiming to prevent aggressive actions. While Pakistan claims an extension of the ceasefire, India maintains full operational readiness.

title: Page Industries, Bharti Airtel & more: Top stocks on brokers' radar today
content: Motilal Oswal recommends buying Page Industries, citing strong volume growth and margin expansion. BNP Paribas has an outperform rating for Bharti Airtel, noting strong financial performance and dividend increases. Elara Securities India maintains a buy rating on REC, while ICICI Securities suggests adding Akzo Nobel due to market share gains.

title: Apple to Indian government after Trump's 'little problem': There is no....
content: Apple has assured the Indian government that its investment plans remain unchanged, despite President Trump's criticism regarding the company's expanding manufacturing presence in India. The tech giant reaffirmed its commitment to India as a major manufacturing hub, even after Trump expressed his preference for increased production in the United States. India's electronics industry remains optimistic, downplaying any potential negative impacts.

title: Mitchell Starc's shocking 'go away' moment with fan at airport
content: Mitchell Starc, Delhi Capitals' pace spearhead, was seen at the airport, seemingly upset with a fan filming him. He will not return for the remainder of IPL 2025, a decision conveyed to the DC management. As the team resumed training, only Dushmantha Chameera was present among overseas players. Starc will not be returning for the remainder of Indian Premier League (IPL) 2025, and it is reliably learnt — as reported by TimesofIndia.com — that the Australian pacer has conveyed his decision to the Delhi Capitals (DC) management.

title: Apple to review India iPhone scale-up plans for US supply
content: Following a tariff truce between the US and China, Apple is reassessing its ambitious Indian expansion plans, particularly those dedicated to supplying the US market. This review comes after Trump's directive against sourcing iPhones from India for US consumption, despite Apple's prior commitment to invest heavily in American manufacturing and job creation.

title: India wants US to cut duties for labour-intensive sectors
content: Foreign Minister Jaishankar emphasized that a mutually beneficial trade deal with the US is expected, where both countries gain. Negotiations are intricate, and no decision is final until all aspects are agreed upon. Discussions are progressing well, with officials slated to conduct further talks, aiming for an early deal covering a limited set of products.

title: What is 'Israel project' request that Google shareholders will vote for
content: Jewish advocacy groups are urging Alphabet shareholders to reject a proposal demanding an investigation into Google's Project Nimbus. The proposal, set for a vote at the company's annual meeting scheduled to be held on June 6, 2025, targets Alphabet's contracts with the Israeli government. Late last year, Google fired over 20 employees after protests over Project Nimbus.

title: Desi diaspora set to take $1.6 billion hit as US plans bill to tax remittances
content: A proposed US bill, dubbed 'The One Big Beautiful Bill,' threatens to impose a 5% remittance tax on non-US citizens, including H-1B and green card holders, sending money abroad. This could significantly impact the Indian diaspora, who remit approximately $32 billion annually to India. If enacted, Indians in the US could face a $1.

title: Unemployment rate at 5.1% in April, shows 1st monthly survey
content: India's unemployment rate stood at 5.1% in April, according to the Periodic Labour Force Survey's first monthly bulletin. Rural areas recorded 4.5% joblessness, while urban centers saw 6.5%. Among those aged 15 and above, the unemployment rate was 5.2% for males and 5% for females. The Labour Force Participation Rate was 55.

title: UK court refuses Nirav Modi bail for 8th time
content: Nirav Modi, the fugitive Indian businessman, has been denied bail for the eighth time by a London court. Justice Fordham cited concerns about Modi absconding and interfering with witnesses. Modi has been imprisoned in the UK since his arrest in March 2019. He is charged with defrauding Punjab National Bank of over $1 billion.

title: Carney picks Trump tariff critic as US-Canada trade minister
content: Prime Minister Mark Carney appointed Dominic LeBlanc, a vocal critic of Donald Trump, as Canada-US trade minister to address ongoing trade disputes. LeBlanc, known for his strong stance against US tariffs, aims to protect Canadian industries and strengthen economic ties. His primary challenge involves navigating the complexities of US trade policies while seeking mutually beneficial outcomes.

title: Indus treaty on hold till Pak stops exporting terror: Jaishankar
content: India's external affairs minister firmly stated that relations with Pakistan will remain bilateral, prioritizing the cessation of cross-border terrorism. He urged Pakistan to hand over terrorists accused of attacking India and dismantle terrorist infrastructure. Regarding the Indus Waters Treaty, India indicated it would be held in abeyance until Pakistan credibly stops cross-border terrorism.

title: 'Raid 2' collection: Ajay Devgn's crime drama mints over Rs 136 crore
content: Ajay Devgn's 'Raid 2' continues its box office dominance, earning Rs 136.35 crore in 15 days. The film maintained strong occupancy, particularly during night shows, even after two weeks. With positive audience reception to its storytelling and performances, 'Raid 2' is on track to potentially cross the Rs 150 crore mark.

title: We killed Dalla ‘aide’ in Ontario: Lawrence gang
content: The Lawrence Bishnoi group claimed responsibility for the murder of Harjit Singh Dhadda, a Sikh businessman, in Mississauga, Ontario. Rohit Godara, an associate of Bishnoi, stated that Dhadda was killed for allegedly assisting Khalistan Tiger Force chief Arsh Dalla with bail. Godara, a wanted man by Interpol, accused Dhadda of supporting their enemies despite prior warnings.

title: Pak a rogue nation with nukes, must be under IAEA scanner: Rajnath Singh
content: Rajnath Singh has termed Pakistan a rogue nation with nukes. He wants its nuclear arsenal under IAEA watch. Singh says Pakistan's nuclear threats failed to deter India's response to terrorism. He calls Operation Sindoor the biggest action against terrorism. Singh adds that if Pakistan supports terrorism, it will pay a heavier price. He recalls Pakistan's past deception regarding terrorism.

title: Now, SP neta’s remarks on IAF officers’ castes stokes row
content: Samajwadi Party leader Ram Gopal Yadav sparked controversy. He mentioned castes of IAF officers Vyomika Singh and A K Bharti. He attacked BJP, accusing them of politicizing Operation Sindoor. BJP leaders criticized Yadav's remarks. They condemned his statement as divisive and disrespectful to the armed forces. Uttar Pradesh CM Yogi Adityanath also slammed Yadav's casteist remarks.

title: Restore Hyderabad forest or be ready to go to jail, SC tells Telangana CS
content: The Supreme Court has strongly reprimanded the Telangana government for illegally deforesting a portion of Kancha Gachibowli forest for an IT center without proper clearances. The court threatened to hold the chief secretary and other officials accountable, potentially sending them to jail, if the deforested area isn't restored through afforestation within two months.

title: Shah checks on securitymen hurt in Operation Blackforest
content: Home Minister Amit Shah visited AIIMS Trauma Centre to check on CRPF and Chhattisgarh Police personnel injured during the 21-day anti-Naxal operation ‘Blackforest’. The operation in the Karreguttalu Hills resulted in injuries, some serious, from IED blasts. Shah assured the injured personnel of the nation's support and pride, directing top-notch care and rehabilitation.

title: Samantha Ruth Prabhu’s manager breaks silence on claims about her moving in with Raj Nidimoru
content: Speculation around Samantha Ruth Prabhu’s growing closeness with filmmaker Raj Nidimoru has taken a different turn after a new report claimed that the duo is planning to take their relationship a step further by moving in together and are actively looking for a place. However, Samantha’s team has now addressed the claims and called them false.

title: In raid on Red fort, Belgian Malinois dies of bee attack
content: In a tragic incident during an anti-Naxal operation in Chhattisgarh, CRPF K9 Rolo, a Belgian Malinois, succumbed to a massive bee sting attack. The brave dog, part of the 228th battalion, was instrumental in detecting explosives and assisting infantry patrols. Despite immediate medical evacuation and treatment, Rolo could not survive the ordeal.

title: ‘Gross subterfuge’: HC slams weak FIR against MP BJP minister
content: The Madhya Pradesh High Court has expressed strong disapproval of the FIR filed against Minister Vijay Shah for his controversial remarks about Colonel Sofiya Qureshi. The court criticized the FIR's lack of specific details regarding the alleged offense, calling it a deliberate attempt to help Shah get the FIR quashed.

title: India makes 1st political contact with Taliban
content: External Affairs Minister S Jaishankar and Amir Khan Muttaqi spoke. They discussed the Pahalgam attack condemnation. India appreciated Afghanistan's stance against Pakistan's claims. Both nations aim to boost cooperation. They addressed visa issues for Afghan citizens. They also discussed the release of Afghan prisoners in India. Focus was on trade and Chabahar port development. India considers resuming projects in Afghanistan.

title: Amid anti-Ankara sentiments, IndiGo defends Turkish tie-up
content: IndiGo defends its partnership with Turkish Airlines, highlighting benefits for Indian travelers and the economy amid political tensions. The airline emphasizes that the codeshare agreement enhances connectivity to Europe and the USA, provides affordable fares, and increases tax contributions. IndiGo's long-haul expansion plans are supported by this collaboration, paving the way for self-sufficiency with new aircraft orders.

title: Govt withdraws security nod to Turkish handler at 9 airports
content: The Indian government, citing national security concerns, has revoked the security clearance for Turkish ground service provider Celebi, impacting its operations at nine Indian airports. This decision follows Turkey's perceived support for Pakistan, particularly after the use of Turkish-origin drones against India. The government is working to ensure minimal disruption and retain Celebi's employees while airports are assuring smooth operations.

title: Must scrap shoddy arbitration clauses, penalise drafters: SC
content: The Supreme Court addresses poorly drafted arbitration clauses. These clauses cause lengthy legal battles. The court says those responsible should face penalties. Judges should reject unclear clauses immediately. A dispute between Municipal Corporation of Delhi and contractors lasted a decade. The court emphasizes the need for precise and clear arbitration clauses. Ambiguity in agreements is a serious concern.

title: Forces gun down 10 militants in op at Myanmar border
content: Assam Rifles successfully neutralized ten militants in a recent operation along the India-Myanmar border in Manipur's Chandel district. Acting on intelligence reports, the Assam Rifles contingent engaged the militants in challenging terrain near the border pillars. An unspecified amount of arms and ammunition were recovered from the slain militants, who are suspected to be members of Myanmar-based armed groups.

title: A river again runs through UP’s parched Jalaun
content: In Uttar Pradesh's Bundelkhand, farmers in Jalaun have successfully revived the 81km-long Noon river, which had dried up due to encroachments and poor rainfall. This community-led effort, praised by PM Modi, involved voluntary labor to restore the river's drainage basin. The revival is expected to benefit over 15,350 farmers by providing a crucial irrigation source.

title: 24-year-old from Sudan studying in Punjab killed
content: A 24-year-old Sudanese student was fatally stabbed, and another was injured in Phagwara, Punjab, during an early morning attack. The victims, along with female companions, were on their way to morning prayers when a group of students and ex-students from Lovely Professional University (LPU) accosted them, leading to a violent confrontation in which knives were used.

title: Univs urged to cut academic ties with Pak, Turkiye & Bangladesh
content: The Association of Indian Universities (AIU) has urged Indian universities to sever ties with institutions in Pakistan, Turkiye, and Bangladesh, citing national security concerns and alleged support for anti-India narratives. Several universities, including JNU and Jamia Millia Islamia, have already suspended or terminated collaborations with Turkish institutions. The AIU frames this as a patriotic duty to protect India's sovereignty.

title: Border posts where BSF duo was martyred to be named after them: BSF DG
content: BSF Director-General Daljit Singh Chawdhary visited Jammu Frontier and declared that border posts where SI Mohammad Imteyaj and Constable Deepak Chingakham were martyred would be named in their honor. He paid tribute to the fallen soldiers, recognizing their supreme sacrifice during cross-border firing in the RS Pura sector.

title: Disabled man pushed off train in row over reserved seat, dies
content: Hitesh Mistry, a 35-year-old disabled man, was killed after being thrown from a train near Jamnagar for objecting to two men occupying a reserved coach. Haji Ayyub Kachhadia and Saddam Qasam, both with prior criminal records, have been arrested in connection with the murder. Mistry and his friend were assaulted and pushed off the Saurashtra Express after an altercation.

title: With IWT in suspension, Omar argues for revival of Tulbul Navigation Project
content: Following the suspension of the Indus Waters Treaty after the Pahalgam terror attack, former J&K Chief Minister Omar Abdullah suggested resuming work on the Tulbul Navigation Barrage in Wullar Lake. The project, halted due to Pakistani objections citing the IWT, could enable Jhelum River navigation and boost downstream power generation, especially during winter.

title: Chhattisgarh CM celebrates success with jawans, locals
content: Chhattisgarh Chief Minister Vishnu Deo Sai visited Galgam village, celebrating the success of Operation Karegutta Hills, which eliminated 31 Maoists and seized a large cache of arms. Sai commended the CRPF jawans' courage and emphasized the government's commitment to transforming security camps into facilitation centers. He reiterated the goal of making Chhattisgarh Maoist-free by March 2026.

title: Pak condemns Rajnath’s remarks, signals robust defence posture
content: Pakistan strongly criticized Indian Defence Minister Rajnath Singh's suggestion for IAEA oversight of its nuclear arsenal, deeming his remarks irresponsible and indicative of insecurity. Pakistan's foreign office highlighted its robust defence capabilities and questioned India's nuclear security, citing instances of alleged radioactive material theft within India.

title: 3 more terrorists killed in Kashmir, total 6 in 48 hours
content: In Jammu and Kashmir, security forces killed three Jaish-e-Mohammad terrorists in Tral. This followed another clash where three Lashkar-e-Taiba men were killed in Shopian. Authorities have urged residents to avoid sharing visuals of the gunfight. Search operations are underway in Reasi and Kathua districts. Amid heightened security, a top army officer visited forward areas in Rajouri and Poonch.

title: BJP takes Tiranga rally to Pahalgam, thousands march in Srinagar
content: BJP organized Tiranga Yatra in Pahalgam and Srinagar, showcasing patriotism and support for the armed forces following Operation Sindoor. The Pahalgam rally, led by Sofi Yousuf, involved local hoteliers and ponywallahs carrying the Tricolour. In Srinagar, the rally culminated at Lal Chowk, with participants expressing solidarity and paying tribute to security forces for dismantling terrorist infrastructure.

title: Congress seeks clarification on President Trump’s ‘zero tariff’ comment
content: Congress leader Jairam Ramesh tagged a report quoting Trump that India had offered ‘zero tariffs’ on several American goods as part of its trade deal with the U.S.

title: Shiv Sena announces ₹10 lakh reward for leads on Pahalgam terrorists
content: The Jammu & Kashmir police have already announced a cash prize of ₹20 lakh. The party will add ₹10 lakh to it.

title: SC collegium recommends Karnataka HC judge K. Somashekar as Chief Justice of Manipur High Court
content: A three-member collegium headed by CJI Gavai in its meeting held on May 15 recommended the appointment in view of retirement of incumbent Chief Justice D. Krishnakumar on May 21

title: Home Minister visits AIIMS, meets injured security personnel
content: Five security personnel were injured in the 21-day anti-Naxal operations on the Chhattisgarh-Telangana border, which concluded on May 11

title: Protests in Goa over NIO hydrologists’ report claiming Mahadayi river diversion will have limited impact on the coastal State
content: The legal dispute between Karnataka and Goa over the sharing of Mahadayi river water has lasted over two decades

title: A textbook with a difference
content: All 84 illustrations of Kerala reader - Malayalam for Class IV are done by women artists and female students

title: Saraswati Pushkaralu-2025: CM promises huge funding to develop Kaleshwaram
content: The Chief Minister took a holy dip at the “Triveni Sangamam”, the confluence of the Godavari, the Pranahita and the subterranean Saraswati rivers in Kaleshwaram, revered as “Trilinga Kshetram”

title: Aviation security regulator revokes security clearance for Turkish airport ground handling company
content: “The security clearance is hereby revoked with immediate effect in the interest of national security,” according to an order from the Bureau of Civil Aviation Security issued on May 15.

title: Speedy decisions need of the hour: Kerala Chief Minister
content: Pinarayi Vijayan addresses regional-level review meeting on the development projects in Thiruvananthapuram, Kollam and Pathanamthitta districts

title: SRMIST commits ₹1 crore to PM relief fund to help kin of Pahalgam victims
content: T.R. Paarivendhar, Founder-Chancellor, SRMIST, conveyed the institute’s condolences and unwavering support through a letter addressed to Prime Minister Narendra Modi

title: Forest officials file preliminary offence report against Peddireddy and family members
content: The charges pertain to the construction of a structure by Mr. Ramachandra Reddy in the reserve forest area, which was in violation of the Forest Act

title: Miss World 2025 contestants soak in Telangana’s cultural tapestry at Bhoodan Pochampally
content: The contestants learnt the intricacies of the weaving process, closely observing artisans at work and even trying their hand at spinning yarn using rattan; captivating beats of traditional Kinnera and Dappu instruments add to the rhythm

title: City police arrest lawyer accused of assaulting junior woman colleague
content: Police will record his detailed statement and produce him before the Judicial First Class Magistrate court on Friday

title: Canal rejuvenation under IURWTS likely to ease waterlogging in Kochi
content: Edappally canal, Perandoor canal, Chilavannoor canal, Thevara canal, Market canal, and Konthuruthy canal will be rejuvenated under the project

title: After postal ballot-tampering remark kicks up a row, G. Sudhakaran does a U-turn
content: Former Minister and senior Communist Party of India (Marxist) says he spoke with a bit of imagination. “I have never engaged in or facilitated bogus voting. Postal ballots were not tampered with. I was only giving a warning to union members who did not vote. I have conveyed this to the election officials who came to record my statement,” he says

title: Lokesh on three-day visit to Anantapur
content: From the inauguration of wind energy plant to participating in JNTU-Anantapur convocation, Minister has packed schedule

title: A.P. teachers to continue protest against G.O. on school restructuring
content: Unions plan to send messages to HRD Minister from May 16 urging him to withdraw the decision to set up nine categories of schools, which they claim will harm the education sector

title: Knowledge Kerala project: facilitation centres to be set up in Ernakulam
content: The facilities will act as a support system to help job seekers and provide them with adequate training

title: Belagavi Police register suo motu case against fake news on Sofia Qureshi
content: A post on X, now deleted, said RSS activists ransacked the residence of Col Qureshi’s father-in-law at Konnur in Gokak taluk of Belagavi district

title: Krishna University achieves 100% placement in pharmacy, engineering departments, students get pat from Minister
content: This is the first time that all students were placed during the placement drive at the Krishna University

title: Closure of catering unit in Kochi: workers in kitchen had no health cards
content: Health wing officials had submitted a report on action taken to the Kochi Corporation secretary; stale food seized from the unit was sent to Brahmapuram for disposal

title: 'I helped': Trump changes tune on India-Pak ceasefire talks
content: Donald Trump again claimed to have mediated a ceasefire between India and Pakistan following India's Operation Sindoor, sparked by a terror attack. Trump stated he encouraged trade talks to de-escalate the conflict, but India has denied any US mediation, reaffirming that discussions with Pakistan will only address terrorism and the return of Pakistan-Occupied Kashmir, emphasizing a strictly bilateral approach.

title: Kerala’s borrowing limit for first nine months of 2025-26 set at ₹29,529 crore
content: This includes a ₹4,000 crore that was initially sanctioned as an ad hoc arrangement at the start of the financial year

title: Mayor contests Behra’s claim on launching boat services through rejuvenated canals in Kochi
content: The services may be feasible only through Edappally, Chilavannoor and part of Thevara-Perandoor canals considering their width. At best, pedal boats can operate in other canals, says Mayor

title: Nellore Rural transformed; 339 completed projects inaugurated in a single day
content: The completed developmental projects include cement roads, drains, parks, and other public amenities and infrastructure

title: India’s trade deficit widens to $8.65 billion in April, services to the rescue again
content: Total exports, including merchandise and services, stood at $824.9 billion in 2024-25, the highest-ever, up 6% from 2023-24

title: Maharashtra Congress chief demands ‘Karnataka and Telangana pattern’ for caste census
content: ‘This census will help determine the exact population of each community, thereby aiding the resolution of the Patidar, Gurjar, and Maratha reservation issues,’ Harshawardhan Sapkal said

title: CM to open Kudumbashree’s 27th anniversary fete on Saturday
content: He will also make an announcement on providing livelihood to three lakh people as part of the Kudumbashree Livelihood Initiative Transformation

title: Rahul’s visit an attempt to revive Congress from its stupor in Bihar
content: The Congress leader might also be looking at a greater seat share in the Opposition alliance for the upcoming Assembly election

title: Graziano makes sense of 10 lingering offseason questions
content: the offseason is not over yet . there are still a few big-name free agents kicking around . the draft is where most of the big moves happen . here, we try to answer your questions about what your team didn't do this offseason .

title: Stanley Cup playoffs daily: Can the Capitals and Jets force Game 6s?
content: the second round of the 2025 Stanley Cup playoffs has reached the point where elimination games will be played every night . first up are the Washington Capitals, down 3-1 and hosting the Carolina Hurricanes ( 7 p.m. ET, TNT . the canes have the third-shortest odds to win the Cup (+325) while the Caps are +1300 .

title: 'You need a reality show for that': How the Giants' quarterback room developed
content: gm Joe Schoen and coach Brian daboll sat down for a meeting with owner John Mara . they had to explain what went wrong and how they were going to move forward . outlined all the potential quarterback options: from the top of the draft with Cam Ward .

title: Ranking MLB's Rivalry Weekend matchups: Which feuds burn hottest?
content: a rivalry weekend begins on friday night . it's one of those old, intrastate civic rivalries that bubbled in the minors for decades . the rivalry has grew slowly at the big league level once interleague play be .

title: Wrestling announcer Ross diagnosed with cancer
content: the 73-year-old was diagnosed this week and is scheduled to have surgery in the next two weeks . "i appreciate your concern and support," he wrote in a social media post . the line, "My God" or "By God," said in his Oklahoma accent after a shocking moment .

title: Ex-MLB star Furcal faces felony charges in Florida
content: former major league shortstop faces felony charges in south Florida . he's charged with aggravated battery with a deadly weapon and throwing a missile into a public or private dwelling or vehicle . his former agent declined to comment on the charges and did not provide a way to reach him directly .

title: Potential upsets? Hitters to watch? Early favorites? We preview the 2025 softball regionals
content: the Oklahoma Sooners begin their quest for a fifth straight ring as the regionals begin on friday . eight of the overall top 10 seeds are from the conference . some of the best pitchers are playing for teams like Texas Tech (NiJaree Canady), Arizona State (Kenzie Brown).

title: The Boston Celtics and the price of history
content: the extended Boston Celtics franchise gathered in a theater to celebrate another championship . a few blocks from the Brahmin church where Bob Cousy eulogized John Havlicek, and from the four-star hotel where Red Auerbach lived . the party was a high table meeting of those witnesses and high priests .

title: Back for more: What will Clark, Reese and 2024 rookie class do for an encore?
content: WNBA rookies caitlin Clark and Angel Reese set rookie records for points (Clark), rebounds and assists . the 2024 draft produced four other players who averaged at least seven points per game last season . a full offseason behind them, plus additional veteran help for several of last year's top rookies .

title: Coast to coast: High school hoops factory relocating from California to Florida
content: Prolific Prep has been a mainstay in the ESPN 25 high school basketball rankings since its inception in 2014 . the team have also produced 14 McDonald's All Americans and been selected to compete in the prestigious Chipotle Nationals tournament for the past six years . this past season, they finished no. 4 in the final ESPN 25 and reached the final Four at the nationals .
